meanings.definition: The act of applying a thin layer of paint to a surface.
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed the patining of her artwork, carefully adding colors to the canvas.
meanings.sent2: The patining of the walls gave the room a fresh and vibrant look.
meanings.sent3: The patining of the fence made it look like a colorful rainbow barrier.
meanings.sent4: Her patining of emotions on the canvas was a reflection of her inner thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The patining of the landscape brought out the beauty of nature in the painting.

meanings.definition: The process of creating a patina on metal.
meanings.sent1: The artist specialized in the patining of metal sculptures, giving them an antique look.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the patining of the copper statue resulted in a greenish patina.
meanings.sent3: The patining of the metal door made it appear as if it had aged gracefully over the years.
meanings.sent4: His skillful patining of the metal surface transformed it into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The patining of the bronze bell added character and depth to its appearance.

meanings.definition: The act of adding a protective coating to a surface.
meanings.sent1: After the patining of the wood, a glossy finish was applied for protection.
meanings.sent2: The patining of the car involved adding a layer of wax to shield it from the elements.
meanings.sent3: The patining of the book cover with plastic wrap kept it safe from spills and tears.
meanings.sent4: His meticulous patining of the table prevented scratches and stains.
meanings.sent5: The patining of the floor with a sealant ensured its durability and longevity.
